  • Method Details

    • create

      public PrivateUserEntity create(String email, String password, PublicUserEntity publicUser) throws InvalidUserPasswordFormatException, InvalidUserEmailException
      Creates and persists a new private user entity with the given email, password, and linked public user.

      Performs validation to ensure the email is unique and the password meets formatting rules. If validations pass, the password is securely encoded and the user is saved.

      Parameters:
      email - the email address to associate with the private user
      password - the raw password to be encoded and stored
      publicUser - the associated public user entity
      Returns:
      the created PrivateUserEntity
      Throws:
      InvalidUserEmailException - if the email is already associated with another user
      InvalidUserPasswordFormatException - if the password does not meet formatting requirements

    • updateEmail

      public void updateEmail(String email, int userId, String password) throws UserNotFoundException, UnchangedEmailException, WrongPasswordException, InvalidUserEmailException
      Updates the email address of an existing private user after verifying the user's password.

      Fails if the new email is the same as the current one or if the provided password is incorrect. After validation, updates the email and persists the user entity.

      Parameters:
      email - the new email address to assign
      userId - the ID of the user whose email is being updated
      password - the current password used for verification
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if no user exists with the given ID
      UnchangedEmailException - if the new email is identical to the current one
      WrongPasswordException - if the provided password is incorrect
      InvalidUserEmailException

    • resetPassword

      public void resetPassword(String token, String password, String confirmPassword) throws PasswordFormatException, JwtKnowyException, UserNotFoundException
      Resets the password of a private user using a valid recovery token.

      Validates the password format and confirms that both provided passwords match. Then verifies the token, retrieves the associated user, and updates the password after encoding it securely.

      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token used for password reset
      password - the new password to set
      confirmPassword - confirmation of the new password
      Throws:
      PasswordFormatException - if the password does not meet the required format
      JwtKnowyException - if the token is invalid or the passwords do not match
      UserNotFoundException - if the user associated with the token does not exist

    • isValidToken

      public boolean isValidToken(String token) throws UserNotFoundException
      Validates a password reset JWT token by decoding and verifying its signature.

      The method performs the following steps:

      • Decodes the token without verifying the signature to extract the user ID.
      • Fetches the corresponding user from the database using the extracted ID.
      • Verifies the token's signature using the user's current password as the secret key.

      If all steps succeed, the token is considered valid. Otherwise, the method returns false.

      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token to validate
      Returns:
      true if the token is well-formed, matches a known user, and its signature is valid; false otherwise
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException

    • save

      public PrivateUserEntity save(PrivateUserEntity user)
      Persists the given private user entity in the database.

      If the user already exists, it will be updated; otherwise, a new record will be created.

      Parameters:
      user - the PrivateUserEntity to persist
      Returns:
      the saved entity, potentially with an updated ID or other persisted fields

    • findPrivateUserById

      public Optional<PrivateUserEntity> findPrivateUserById(Integer id)
      Retrieves a private user entity by its ID if it exists.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the private user
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the user if found, or empty if not

    • getPrivateUserById

      public PrivateUserEntity getPrivateUserById(Integer id) throws UserNotFoundException
      Retrieves a private user entity by its ID or throws an exception if not found.

      This is a convenience method that wraps findPrivateUserById(Integer) and ensures the result is non-null.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the private user
      Returns:
      the PrivateUserEntity if found
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if no user exists with the given ID

    • findPrivateUserByEmail

      public Optional<PrivateUserEntity> findPrivateUserByEmail(String email)
      Retrieves a private user entity by email if it exists.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the private user
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the user if found, or empty if not

    • getPrivateUserByEmail

      public PrivateUserEntity getPrivateUserByEmail(String email) throws UserNotFoundException
      Retrieves a private user entity by email or throws an exception if not found.

      This method guarantees a non-null result and is typically used in flows where the presence of a user is required.

      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the private user
      Returns:
      the PrivateUserEntity associated with the given email
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if no user exists with the specified email

    • createRecoveryPasswordEmail

      public MailMessage createRecoveryPasswordEmail(String email, String recoveryBaseUrl) throws UserNotFoundException, JwtKnowyException
      Creates a recovery password email for the given user email.

      Generates a JWT token associated with the user, builds the email content using the provided base URL, and returns a MailMessage object containing the recipient, subject, and body.

      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user requesting password recovery
      recoveryBaseUrl - the base URL to be used for building the recovery link
      Returns:
      a MailMessage ready to be sent
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if no user exists with the given email
      JwtKnowyException - if token generation fails

    • createDeletedAccountEmail

      public MailMessage createDeletedAccountEmail(String email, String recoveryBaseUrl) throws JwtKnowyException, UserNotFoundException
      Creates an email message with a recovery link for a deleted user account. The recovery link contains a token that expires after 30 days.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user whose account was deleted
      recoveryBaseUrl - the base URL used to generate the account recovery link
      Returns:
      a MailMessage containing the recovery email details (receiver, subject, and body)
      Throws:
      JwtKnowyException - if an error occurs while encoding the JWT token
      UserNotFoundException - if no user is found for the given email

    • desactivateUserAccount

      public void desactivateUserAccount(String email, String password, String confirmPassword) throws WrongPasswordException, UserNotFoundException
      Deactivates a user account by verifying the provided password and confirmation password.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user whose account will be deactivated
      password - the password entered by the user for verification
      confirmPassword - the confirmation password to ensure correctness
      Throws:
      WrongPasswordException - if the passwords do not match or the password is incorrect
      UserNotFoundException - if no user is found for the given email

    • reactivateUserAccount

      public void reactivateUserAccount(String token) throws JwtKnowyException, UserNotFoundException
      Reactivates a user account based on a valid token.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token used to verify the reactivation request
      Throws:
      JwtKnowyException - if the token is invalid or cannot be processed
      UserNotFoundException - if no user is associated with the token

    • verifyPasswordToken

      public PrivateUserEntity verifyPasswordToken(String token) throws JwtKnowyException, UserNotFoundException
      Verifies the authenticity and validity of a password reset token and retrieves the associated user.

      This method performs two decoding steps:

      1. Unverified decoding to extract the user ID from the token payload.
      2. Verified decoding using the user's password as the secret key to validate the token's integrity and expiration.
      If both steps succeed, the method returns the corresponding PrivateUserEntity.

      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token to verify
      Returns:
      the PrivateUserEntity linked to the token
      Throws:
      JwtKnowyException - if the token is invalid, expired, or has been tampered with
      UserNotFoundException - if no user exists for the extracted user ID
